Analysis.name: All-cause mortality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Simple randomization method was applied, but there was no detailed information on the allocation sequence and concealment. There were no baseline differences between intervention groups.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Double blinding was mentioned, but there was no information whether carers of people delivering interventions were blinded. There was no information on whether there were deviations from intended interventions due to trial context. There was no information regarding estimating an effect of assignment to intervention. Due to participants excluded post-randomisation, there is a potential for effect on outcome for failure to analyse all participants.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: There was missing data for 16 participants enrolled into the trial and randomised into trial arms. It is not known which trial arms they were randomised to. They were excluded on the basis of negative serological testing. It is therefore likely that the missing participants with negative serological testing may have affected the analysis of the outcome.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: This domain of bias may not be applicable to a mortality as this is a binary outcome. However, double blinding was mentioned in the methodology.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: A pre-specified analysis plan was not available. Only one measure for this outcoem was used, and there was no evidence of multiple eligible analysis of the data for this outcome.
Overall.bias.support: As summarized across other fields and through the ROB2 algorithm.

Analysis.name: All-cause mortality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: The trial was randomised, but no detailed information about the allocation sequence and concealment was made available. The intervention groups had similair age averages and clinical symptoms.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: There was no information about awareness of participants, carers, and people delivering the interventions. There was no information regarding deviations from the intended interventions that arose because of the trial context. There was no evidence of difference between assigned and received intervention.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Only one participant from the treatment arm and one participant from the control arm were withdrawn as they did not meet the inclusion critieria of laboratory diagnosis.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: The method for measuring mortality was appropriate, and it is unlikely that the this differed between groups. Despite no information on blinding of outcome assesors, it is unlikely that measurement of this outcome would be influenced by knowledge of the intervention.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: A pre-specified analysis plan was not available. There were was no evidence of multiple eligible outcome measurements or analysis.
Overall.bias.support: As summarized across other fields and through the ROB2 algorithm.

Analysis.name: All-cause mortality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Participants were allocated randomly, but detailed information regarding this was not available. There was no evidence of baseline differences between intervention groups that would suggest a problem with the randomisation process.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: There was no information regarding blinding of participants. The trial is labelled as "open", but otherwise there is no information of blinding of providers. There was no information provided on any deviations from intended interventions due to trial context. An intention-to-treat analysis was performed on all randomised participants, and a sub-group analysis was performed on a sub-set of Leptospirosis confirmed participants for one outcome (mortality)
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: There was no missing data reported from the trial.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: The outcome measure was appropriate. There was no indication measurement of the otucome differed between group. Although there was no information on blinding past the trial being "open", it is unlikely that the assessment of the outcome could have been influenced by knowledge of the intervention.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: There was no information regarding a pre-specified analysis plan. There were multiple eligible anlayses of the data included, specifically both an intention-to-treat and per-protocol analysis being performed. For the outcome of mortality, both an intention-to-treat and an author-defined per-protocol analysis were done and reported as such.
Overall.bias.support: As summarized across other fields and through the ROB2 algorithm.
